text: everyday vocabulary topic pots and pans
let's take a look in the cabinet this is
where I keep my pots and pans I don't
have anything too fancy in fact these
are very old I have my favorite sauce
pans skillets nonstick skillet so very
nice for cooking eggs or pancakes
actually I have something better for
pancakes I like cooking omelets in a
nonstick skillet but for good pancakes
you can use one of these cast-iron
skillet
these were my grandmother's you're very
heavy and very old I have do you know
justice this is a food pill you can
puree things like potatoes other
vegetables I have different pots good
for boiling things and oh this is nice
special kind of hot but see this one has
holes I put water in this saucepan and
put this on top with vegetables for
example and as the water boils it steams
the vegetables should have some kind of
strainer colander pasta smaller strainer
for vegetables or just to wash them
fruits now listen and repeat
sauce pan sauce pans have long handles
pot a pot has handles on either side lid
you use a lid to cover a pot or saucepan
colander and strainer we use a colander
and strainer to strain foods for example
you can strain pasta that's removing all
of the liquid without losing the food a
colander is larger and a strainer is
often smaller but has a long handle
kitchen cabinet
we can also call these cupboards the
word is written like cup board but we
say cupboard cabinet and cupboard
